title: Scientists challenge US wildlife director's qualifications
description: Dozens of scientists from universities and environmental groups are pushing for the removal of the head of the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service

title: CPSC calls on Meta, Mattel to get Fisher-Price Rock 'n Play sleepers off the market
description: Fisher-Price's Rock 'n Play sleeper was recalled in 2019 after dozens of infant deaths.

title: Manhattan DA receives new suspicious white powder envelope: Police sources
description: The NYPD is responding to a new threatening letter sent to Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg, according to police sources.

title: Families of police brutality victims gather to turn 'grief into action'
description: The panel of family members of police brutality victims featured relatives of of Eric Garner, Ahmaud Arbery, George Floyd, Trayvon Martin, Tyre Nichols and more.

title: Whole Foods closes flagship San Francisco store over employee safety concerns
description: Overall crime is down 10% this year but robberies are up 13%, police data shows.

title: WATCH:  New Zealand zoo welcomes pair of endangered snow leopards
description: The Wellington Zoo is welcoming new residents, the only two snow leopards in New Zealand.

title: Fox News sanctioned by judge in Dominion defamation case over discovery delays
description: A judge overseeing Dominion Voting System's defamation suit against Fox News imposed a sanction against the network after it made "misrepresentations" to the court.

title: 'Harry Potter' TV series based on book series announced
description: A TV show based on the "Harry Potter" book series was announced by Max, a new streaming platform combining HBO Max and Discovery+.

title: US will not prosecute suspect in US tourist death in Mexico
description: U.S. officials in North Carolina say they will not federally prosecute the person suspected of killing a Charlotte-area woman vacationing in Mexico last year

title: Man ordered back to prison 2 years after his murder conviction was set aside
description: Crosley Green has been ordered to return to prison, two years after being freed by a federal judge, who set aside his Florida murder conviction.

title: Umpire struck in head by relay throw, leaves game
description: Second base umpire and crew chief Larry Vanover was struck in the head with a throw on during a frightening moment in the sixth inning of the New York Yankees' game against the Cleveland Guardians

title: Gov. DeSantis surrogates escalate tit-for-tat versus Disney
description: There’s a new salvo in the fight to control Disney World

title: Shelby County Board of Commissioners votes to reinstate expelled lawmaker
description: Less than a week after being ousted, District 86 representative Justin J. Pearson has just been reinstated by a unanimous vote.

title: Record heat heading to Northeast: What to expect
description: Record heat is moving from the Southwest to the Midwest and the Northeast, where temperatures could approach 90 degrees in some areas this week.

title: Space race! Meteorites hit Maine, museum offers $25K reward
description: Somewhere in a remote stretch of forest near Maine’s border with Canada, rocks from space crashed to Earth and may be scattered across the ground — just waiting to be picked up

title: Federal prosecutors will not pursue charges in Shanquella Robinson's death
description: Federal prosecutors will not bring charges in the murder of Shanquella Robinson, a North Carolina resident who was killed in October while vacationing in Mexico.

title: Juul to pay $462 million settlement, AGs say
description: Juul to pay $462 million settlement for 'central role in the youth vaping epidemic,' AGs say

title: NPR leaves Twitter amid dispute over labeling
description: Owned by Elon Musk, NPR said that the social media company’s label of their organization is meant to undermine their credibility.

title: Kansas man's lawsuit says he was chased, tased for speeding
description: A federal lawsuit alleges that an 80-year-old Kansas man was pursued by police and tased by a deputy for driving 3 mph over the speed limit

title: New York City names its first-ever 'rat czar'
description: "Rats are tough but New Yorkers are tougher."

title: Tupperware could go out of business, here's why
description: The Tupperware stock price plummeted nearly 50% and the company said it could go out of business.

title: Big flames, raining embers in New Jersey pine barrens fire
description: A massive 3,800-acre forest fire in Ocean County, New Jersey is about half contained as officials continue to battle flames

title: Ariana DeBose to host Tony Awards for a consecutive year
description: Ariana DeBose’s stint as host of last year’s Tony Awards went so well she’s been asked to return this year

title: Italy plans hefty fines for vandalism to monuments, cultural sites
description: Italy’s Cabinet on Tuesday approved a bill to fine vandals who damage monuments or other cultural sites up to 60,000 euros ($65,559).

title: NPR quits Elon Musk's Twitter over 'government-funded' label
description: Last week, Twitter labeled NPR's main account as "state-affiliated media."

title: RoboCop? No, RoboDog: Robotic dog rejoins New York police
description: New York City officials have unveiled three new high-tech policing devices including a robotic dog that critics called creepy when it first joined the police pack 2 1/2 years ago

title: Bottoms up! Some MLB teams extend beer sales to 8th inning
description: Thanks to the pitch clock, the action is moving much faster at Major League Baseball games

title: Price hikes slowed significantly in March
description: The inflation data arrives less than a month after the Fed imposed its latest rate hike.

title: 3 Sherpa climbers missing after falling on Mount Everest
description: Three Sherpa climbers are missing after falling into a deep crevasse on a treacherous section of Mount Everest just above the base camp

title: Credit Suisse rescue rebuked by half of Swiss parliament
description: Switzerland’s lower house of parliament has issued a searing — though symbolic — rebuke of an emergency plan spearheaded by the executive branch to prop up embattled Credit Suisse and shepherd it into a takeover by Swiss banking rival UBS

title: Volcano spews ash cloud for 2nd day on Russia's Kamchatka
description: A massive volcanic eruption is spewing out ash for a second day on Russia’s far eastern Kamchatka Peninsula, throwing clouds of dust high into the sky and blanketing wide areas

title: Musk says owning Twitter 'painful' but needed to be done
description: Billionaire Elon Musk has told the BBC that running Twitter has been “quite painful” but that the social media company is now roughly breaking even after he acquired it late last year

title: China says Taiwan encirclement drills a 'serious warning'
description: China says recent air and sea drills simulating an encirclement of Taiwan were intended as a “serious warning” to pro-independence politicians on the self-governing island and their foreign supporters

title: Mexican immigration agency chief to be charged in fatal fire
description: Mexico's top immigration official will face criminal charges in a fire that killed 40 migrants last month

title: Florida set to execute 'ninja killer' for 1989 murders
description: Florida is ramping up executions under Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis, with a man known as the “ninja killer” set to die

title: WATCH:  Arnold Schwarzenegger fills giant pothole in his Los Angeles neighborhood
description: In the wake of the recent storms that drenched Southern California, Arnold Schwarzenegger decided to take matters into his own hands to patch up a giant pothole in his Los Angeles neighborhood.
